column2: MAINE DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column6: The car approaching from the left.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 2. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 3. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column4: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.
column8: the pedestrian is blind.

column2: 4. You should increase your following distance:
column6: at night or if it is raining.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 5. Drivers should use the horn:
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column10: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 6. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column8: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

column2: 7. A flashing red light means:
column4: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: The traffic signal is broken.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 8. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column6: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.
column8: yield to the vehicles on your left only.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: Pavement is narrowing

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway ends

column2: 11. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
column6: during the first half hour of rain.
column8: when it's been raining all day.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 13. Roads are most slippery during the first rain.
14. Pedestrians at intersections have the right-of-way over vehicles.
15. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
column8: slow down gradually

column2: 16. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column6: always drive at the highest speed allowed.
column8: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 18. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 19. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 20. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column8: in any direction.

column2: 21. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 22. If weather requires you to have your lights on, you should use your:
column8: high beams.

column2: 23. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Side road entering from the left
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 25. Bicyclists making a left hand turn:
column4: should wait on the right side of the road.
column8: may use the left lane.

column2: 26. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column6: place their foot on the accelerator.
column8: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

column2: 27. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when it helps to prevent collisions.
column6: when the other drivers are on your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
column8: when your traffic signal is a green.
column10: when they are driving a truck.

column2: 28. Broken white lines can be crossed over:
column4: when it is safe to change lanes.
column8: only in passing zones.

column2: 29. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column6: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.

column2: 30. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
column8: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 31. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column4: only after entering the intersection on a green light.
column8: under no circumstances.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column8: Slippery road ahead

column2: 33. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must go to the next intersection.
column6: must turn into its left lane.
column8: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 34. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 35. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column8: vehicles from the right.

column2: 36. This sign indicates:
column4: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column6: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column8: a steep grade is ahead.
column10: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.

column2: 37. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column8: on the right.

column2: 38. Drivers should change lanes:
column8: gradually and carefully.

column2: 39. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: on the opposite side of the street.
column6: if you have the green light.
column8: in a marked crosswalk.

column2: 40. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.
column8: decrease their following distance.

column2: 41. When you drive into the street from any driveway you:
column4: can disregard pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
column6: must drive slowly so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can get out of your way.
column8: must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
column10: must honk the horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians can allow you room.

column2: 42. Your ability to drive safely can be impaired by:
column8: drugs, even if they are over-the-counter.

column2: 43. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column6: when pedestrians are crossing within a marked or unmarked crosswalk.
column8: by slowing down and making sure they are being seen by pedestrians.

column2: 44. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column8: you should give yourself additional time to stop.

column2: 45. Large trucks:
column4: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column6: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
column8: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.

column2: 46. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: stay in the center of your lane
column8: steer left
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 47. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column6: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.
column8: not use high beam headlights.

column2: 48. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: On slippery roads.

column2: 49. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Take a cold shower before driving.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 50. BAC is expressed in:
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 51. Drivers should treat a railroad crossbuck sign the same as a yield sign.
52. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 53. If traffic prevents you from crossing all the way across a set of railroad tracks:
column4: proceed only when at least one-half of your vehicle can cross the tracks safely.
column6: proceed only when there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until no trains are in sight.
column10: wait until the approaching train has come to a stop.

column2: 54. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column6: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column8: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column10: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.

column2: 55. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 56. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 57. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turns

column2: 58. Drinking alcohol and then driving is dangerous because it affects your:
column8: coordination.

column2: 59. To be able to turn quickly, your hands should be:
column4: placed outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides
column6: on the steering wheel, so they are at the 6 and 12 o'clock positions.
column8: next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.

column2: 60. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: speed up.
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.
